results.name: Square array read by antidiagonals: number of ways a pawn-like piece (with the initial 2-step move forbidden and starting from any square on the back rank) can end at various squares on an infinite chessboard.
comment: Table formatted as a square array shows the top-left corner of the infinite board.
link: Hans L. Bodlaender, The Chess Variant Pages
Hans L. Bodlaender et al., editors, The Piececlopedia (An overview of several fairy chess pieces)
maple: ChessPawnTriangleV := proc(r,c) option remember; if(r < 2) then RETURN(0); fi; if(c < 1) then RETURN(0); fi; if(2 = r) then RETURN(1); fi; RETURN(ChessPawnTriangleV(r-1,c-1)+ChessPawnTriangleV(r-1,c)+ChessPawnTriangleV(r-1,c+1)); end;
